response_parsed.title: Containerizing Batch Jobs using FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer demonstrates how to containerize batch jobs using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs in Python 3.12+. It utilizes Uvicorn as the ASGI server and Docker for containerization.
key_points: FastAPI provides an easy-to-use, high-performance, web framework for building RESTful APIs in Python.
Uvicorn is the recommended ASGI server for FastAPI, providing a simple way to run the application as a server within a Docker container.
Docker is used for containerization, allowing the deployment of applications across different environments without worrying about compatibility issues.
This setup makes it easier to manage and scale batch jobs, as they can be triggered via HTTP requests to the FastAPI endpoint.
version_notes: FastAPI version: Latest compatible with Python 3.12
Uvicorn version: Latest compatible with FastAPI and Python 3.12
caveats: Ensure you have Docker installed on your system.
Replace the `process_batch` function with your own batch processing logic.
In a real-world application, consider using an orchestration tool like Kubernetes for scaling and managing your FastAPI containerized batch jobs.
